column4: so anyone encountered problems with apt-get, unable to downgrade or reinstall from an unsuccessful install?
downgrading is not supported, what error are you getting ?
i don't know what error, cuz read the pastebin, it doesn't say, its not so much down grading as purging the new release, and trying to install the old one back, http://pastebin.com/d244aa21
how did you got with the 5.1 release ?
yes, the 5.0 preinstallation fails because you have already 5.1 installed, and it's getting in it's way in some part of the pre install script
adding random repositories is not recommended
do you have any data on mysql that you care about ?
what should I do? find all the files matching '*mysql*' and delete them?
no, you do a purge on mysql-common
so yes, purge failed you will need to manually identify the mysql 5.1 files
i deleted all the files '*mysql*5.1*' but it didn't help, i think its written in some files somewhere, you have any suggestions?
yes, you will need to read the mysql-server pre-install script, the script must mention the files that are being checked
where do i find the installation script for the package?
